intro: Decastemon hirtus, commonly known as the hairy decastemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered white or pink flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered with fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often grown as an ornamental plant in gardens due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
